storyInfo: The battle between the Damazti Cluster and Eblana causes an explosion in the blockade area. The Glasgow Gang organizes an evacuation of the district. Baird goes missing in the chaos, and Siege leads the effort, sword in hand.

attributes.content: There are more people following than I thought.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They don't necessarily think that they have a better chance with you.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: They don't stand behind me because they trust me. They just don't have any other choice.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Footsteps are convincing. The more people join us, the less others will hesitate. When we...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: When we and Her Royal Highness arrive at the blockade, there will be more cannon fodder?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I'll be standing at the fore, Cador.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Hey, what's that in the sky?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: The Sarkaz airship... they're taking off.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: This is our—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No, that's—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The crowd falls silent, gazing up at the airship above.
In their eyes is reflected the eerie purple flame, slowly falling towards the ground.
The cold flame impacts the earth, the sparks flying onto the fleeing crowd, as though they had a mind of their own.
The fire spreads uncontrollably, instantly engulfing the refugees.
They fall to the ground, screaming.
Then, their lifeless bodies rise from the fire, the purple flame of desire burning in their eyes.
Dead silence.
All present bore witness to the 'miracle'.
A-Another of those devils' tricks?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: They won't even let us die?
attributes.name: Frightened Refugee

attributes.content: The rain of purple fire descends, like the mantle of death itself.
Fear spreads in the crowd. The silence is broken, replaced by panic.
Get away from the fire! Hurry!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The houses by the street are burning.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do you see that, Siege?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This purple fire is beyond the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I've heard stories of the dead coming back to life... stories about a Draco.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The leader of Dublinn. The red dragon of avarice... she's here. Her flame descends upon us.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She hides her ambition no more, Siege.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I don't care who she is.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: All I care is that we need to run. Now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Look out!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Looks like age has not taught you patience.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Why do you fear my fire, if you're so eager to fight me?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Or have you forsaken the intelligence that you were so proud of, once you began serving the Regent?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Interesting, little Draco, your fire... very interesting.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: If you know about our existence, then you know that this vessel is simply one of our innumerable fragments.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: This is simply a little warning, delivered in passing. You are not in our field of view.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Your soul is too shallow, too barren. You do not even attempt to hide the flame of ambition, the desire for power in your eyes.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Unlike the Banshee whom we are speaking to, even now, we are not even interested in asking any questions of you.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: I have no need to hide. My fire burns away all, as it does now.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I can't wait until the cluster of Damazti kneels before me in fire.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Do you hear the sound of screaming beneath your feet, hatchling?
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: I lead them. They adore me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: This is my duty. You do not understand, ancient wanderer.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Many years ago, the country beneath our feet was not the farce it is today. We met a Draco in southern Victoria, one as young as you are now.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: 'I lead them. They adore me.' He said the same words, before his death in battle.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: His brood submitted to the empire's glow, whether it was those who made peace with the Aslan, or you.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: How do you think you compare to your conquering forefathers?
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: You're not worthy to speak of my kin's suffering.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And I'm not worthy to speak of the red dragon who wrote the history of Tara.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But the beautiful memories that you speak of have left Tara a long time ago.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The old Draco kings were no greater than we are. We sought fairness. He made his choice, and I made mine.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You, long-lived, you boast of the seasons that you've seen, the scope of your knowledge.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But the wealth that you are so proud of has not changed your life in the slightest. How pathetic.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Observe and seek. That is all you have in all your years, no?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Neither of us see the other as a welcome guest. Why not end this pointless argument?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Thank you, little Draco, for making this chore somewhat interesting.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: You'll remember me, Damazti.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: There will be a chapter with my name on it in your long and winding memory.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The fire outside...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Now's no time to stare. Pack up and let's catch up with... Morgan?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Do you regret what you said to Vina?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I don't know why. It just came out... I didn't mean to blame her.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I wanted someone to tell me that the nightmare was over, that everything would get better. That someone used to be Vina.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Remember this tape? You spent a pretty penny to get it from McClaren.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Bastard lied to me, said it was limited edition and worth a lot.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: He wasn't wrong. How many times did you watch it with Vina on the sofa? Ten? Twenty?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Tell you what. Grab it, and we'll all watch it for the twenty-first time when we get out of here and find our new hideout. How about that?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: She never changed, did she?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It was Norport that changed.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Speaking of video... there's someone I haven't notified.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You go first. Tell Vina I'll catch up soon.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The lights by the streets of Norport have gone out. Only the purple flames spreading through the city light Baird's path.
Burning silhouettes stare blankly at the sky, listening to the call of 'The Leader.'
But the dark night conceals the airship in the sky. Not even the purple flames reaching towards the skies could reveal it.
Damn it, what are those people... those things looking at?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I have to find McClaren, meet up with Vina. It's not safe here. I think he lives over here...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: It's too dark. Should have brought my flashlight.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: His neon sign used to stay lit all night.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Those burning... things... had better not jump me like those movie monsters.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Third from the left... third from the left... there!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: McClaren!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The next house is burning! We have to go!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: No one answers Baird in the darkness. All she hears is the crackling of fire on wood.
Baird presses her ear against the gap, and hears the faint chattering of teeth and agitated breathing echo in the empty house.
McClaren! Thank heavens you're alive.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Oh yeah, Morgan said he's deaf...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I need a pen... I've got one here in my pocket!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: 'It's not safe here. We need to go.'
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: 'I'm Baird. Take the planks down.'
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Read the note, bloody hell, do you see it or not?!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: There's no time. I need to go in...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: It's okay, McClaren. I just need to pry your windows open.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird widens the gap in the planks using her knife, then tries to pry them open with the handle.
Almost there, almost there!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: (Go away...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: Are you talking? I can't hear you. The planks aren't that tough. Hang in there!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: (Get away from me... get away from me...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: What are you saying? Damn, the fire's spreading quickly.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Hurry... hurry...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Last two. Do you see me, McClaren?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: 'Come over to the door.' The fire's spreading. We're out of time!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Look this way! Isn't it clear enough?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: (Go away... get away from me...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: Stand back. I'll kick the last planks in.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Stay away!!!
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: A silver flash. Baird takes a step back, touches her cheek, and finds it wet with a warm liquid.
What the...?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: McClaren...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The familiar video shop owner stands behind the door.
The blood flowing from his ears lies dried on his neck. Originium crystals cover a large part of his ears. Morgan was right. He has likely gone deaf.
He's muttering at the only light in the room, oblivious to everything else.
Otherwise, he would not have been so frightened when he saw that it was her standing outside, would not have swung his knife.
Or perhaps not.
He would have done so, no matter who opened the door.
The calamity outside has taken his hearing, and almost everything else he had. He stands alone with his knife, only a few fragile planks between the world and the last bit of food he has.
This is mine... I have nothing left...
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: McClaren...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I want to live... please... I just want to live. I've given you everything else...
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: What do you still want from me?
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: (This is mine...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: Look at me, McClaren. It's Baird. I'll take care of you.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Put down your knife. Take my hand.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: 'Put down your knife.' Can you read it?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The fire is spreading. We've no time.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Right, just like that. I'll come over slowly. No need to be scared.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Finally, Baird sees the once-familiar video shop owner in his entirety.
She finds that it is not a lamp that illuminates the room, but the tiny projector that they spent countless days and nights with.
I'll take your hand and help you up.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: (I want to live...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: You will. We all will.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird touches the feeble arm. Her heart skips a beat at the solidness of the Originium crystals beneath the soft muscles.
It's ok. We'll all live. You'll have a new video shop, and I'll have a new gym.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: (I want to live...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: Relax... now I'm going to take your knife. You're safe. You don't need it.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Thank you... thank you...
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: She reaches out slowly to the knife that McClaren is holding. There is a little bump under his clothes, the last food that McClaren has left.
Baird takes McClaren's knife. The muscles of the trembling man relax for the first time in many days.
Baird sees an emotion other than fear in the man's eyes. Perhaps he has recognized her.
The thing in the bump falls out from under his clothes. It's an empty can.
We can go now.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: (That's mine...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: Baird exhales and bends down to pick up the empty can.
But this is emp—
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird feels a sharp pain in her midsection. The knife that should have been in her hand is now halfway inside her. McClaren was the one who seized her hand.
It's mine! Mine!
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: Mine...
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: (I'll live. You said you'll leave me food...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: I... ugh...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: He stumbles towards Baird and snatches away the meaningless, empty can.
(I'll live. I'll protect myself...)
attributes.name: McClaren

attributes.content: His knife is now inside Baird. He anxiously looks for a new weapon.
He sees Baird's butterfly knife, his delirious eyes reflected in the cold blade.
Baird has had the knife for a long time.
When the members of the Glasgow Gang were just children, Baird bought it at the flea market at a discount, and never let it leave her side.
It has seen many battles, many celebrations with her. It was not particularly valuable, nor did Baird particularly treasure it. It just became a habit.
McClaren's struggle was feeble. That one stab took almost all the strength he had left.
But Baird found that she could not fight back.
McClaren gasps a few times and pulls with what strength he has left. The blade almost pierces his neck.
Careful! Don't... hurt yourself.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird cannot lift her arm. She releases the knife.
The man takes the weapon, cradles the can, and stumbles into the light of the inferno outside.
Haha, haha.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: It hurts... gotta get Hannah to wrap it up... I hope she learned how to do it gently in her time out there.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Ugh... I can hardly stand...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: McClaren, you bastard... I don't remember owing you any money...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Leastwise, I can't remember.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I have to catch up to them... Vina'll worry...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: That's probably the last group that would follow us.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The flames are burning fierce!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Looks like we made it, Doctor.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Yes... I'm fine.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Finally. Hurry, while—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Seems like the airship taking off was enough to get the dukes' attention.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.options: Is that the Duke of Windermere's forces?

attributes.content: I don't know and I have no time to care.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We need to go, Siege!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We can't wait for the dukes and the Sarkaz to have it out—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No! Baird's not here yet!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Two minutes. No, one. Baird runs fast.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You see those walking carcasses on the street? Who knows if they don't want a piece of us, even if we got away from the bombing and the fire.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We have no time!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Where's Baird, Morgan?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She went to look for the video shop owner. It's on the far side...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What's more important to you, your subjects or your gang?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: That's the question you'll need to answer, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Where are you going, Cador?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm just a Glasgow punk. I don't need to think about the things that you have to, 'Your Highness'.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Baird's one of my own. I've got to take care of her.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I look forward to seeing whether you'll keep your promise, and always stand at the fore of these people.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: ...I hope you do.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Cador squeezes past the silent crowd and goes back into the blockade area.
Let me go, Morgan! Say something, Vina!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah! Is that McClaren? There at the end of the line... he just joined it!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Cador stops in his tracks.
The cowering man at the end of the line looks around gingerly, then disappears into the crowd.
McClaren...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's him! Baird's caught up!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That thing in his hand—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Baird should be around here. Weren't they together? Wait... how did McClaren end up with Baird's knife?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan finds the answer.
She finds it in the bloodstains on the knife in the video shop owner's hand, and in Vina's eyes before she turned away.
Tears rush into her eyes, but she cannot wipe them away. She needs both her hands to stop Indra from trying to squeeze past the crowd.
Let me go, Morgan, or I'll sock you!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: (You saw it, Vina...)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: (Baird—)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Strength. Vina has never wanted it so much.
A little strength. A lot of strength. The strength of anger. The strength of sorrow.
Anything.
Anything to shatter all that lies before her, anything to make things right again.
Even just a little bit—
Even if it was just enough for her to turn around, to find a friend that she has not yet had the time to catch up with.
Even if...
Kyngasycath is heavy in her hands, almost immovable.
Nothing. There is nothing.
Your Royal Highness... are we not going?
attributes.name: Nervous Citizen

attributes.content: You will take us away from here, yes?
attributes.name: Nervous Citizen

attributes.content: Don't call me 'Your Highness'. I'm not anybody's Highness.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm just... no, never mind.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Stay at your post, Indra!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We break the walls now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You'll leave Baird behind?! After we've already done so once?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And I know she would not willingly part with us again.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Unless... she had no choice.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: As we do not.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Why did we come back to Norport, then?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Maybe coming back was more than just about coming back, the moment that we stepped foot on the soil of our home...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Let go of Hannah, Morgan. Have some faith in the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We're no wimps.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Remember how we fought our battles when we were little?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: For the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: For the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Bastards... wait for us, Baird...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: For the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The walls that block the escape of the people of Norport lie just before them, but there are no longer Sarkaz bows and guns on it.
Freedom is in sight. The oppressed raise their hands high and push forth.
Siege raises Kyngasycath high again. It is still just a piece of metal, not a single sheen to it.
She does not remember whether she swung it. Perhaps it is just the result of countless hands pushing at the same time. The wall falls.
